item.title: Huawei Founder Ren Zhengfei Takes Off the Gloves in Fight Against U.S.
item.description: Internal communications show how Chinese telecom giant pivoted to counter Washington’s charges with lawsuits and reorganization; “the company has entered a state of war.”

item.title: Vatican Arrests Suspect in London Real-Estate Scandal
item.description: The Vatican announced its first arrest in connection with a financial scandal over the Holy See’s investments in London real estate.

item.title: Trump to Pull Thousands of U.S. Troops From Germany
item.description: The president directed the Pentagon to remove 9,500 U.S. troops from Germany by September, a move that would dramatically reshape the U.S. military posture in Europe and reflects strains between the two allies.

item.title: George Floyd's Killing Sparks Protests in Europe, Soul-Searching in France
item.description: The killing has kicked off demonstrations and sporadic vandalism in Europe. In France, it has rekindled controversies over institutional racism and police violence in a society divided after the monthslong yellow-vest protests.

item.title: U.S. Eases Flight Ban on Chinese Airlines
item.description: The Trump administration eased off a plan to block all flights by mainland Chinese airlines to the U.S. after China said it would permit some passenger flights by U.S. airlines.

item.title: China and India Try to Ease Border Tensions
item.description: China and India are elevating talks between military leaders to try to calm tensions along their disputed borders in the Himalayan mountains.
